definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A blocked vent had caused the tank to buckle.
sentences.chinese: 有一条封闭的管子使罐子紧扣。

sentences.english: Why not throw it all in the pot and see what happens?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不把它全扔进罐子，看看会发生什么变化？

sentences.english: The jars should not be packed so tightly that any single leaf could not be easily pulled out by its stem.
sentences.chinese: 的罐子，不应该装得那么紧，不容易被拉任何单叶茎。

sentences.english: I take the urn to bed with me, and I talk to him about my day.
sentences.chinese: 我带着骨灰罐子上床，跟他说我这一天怎么过的。

sentences.english: She said the fire’d go out and her jars would break .
sentences.chinese: 她说炉火会熄灭的，她的罐子就会冻破。

sentences.english: Uli looked at the floor of the jar asked.
sentences.chinese: 乌利中尉看着地上的罐子问。

sentences.english: I will break it! Then I will drink the water as it pours out.
sentences.chinese: 水从破罐子里流出来，我就能喝上了。

sentences.english: I have some proprietary jars that cannot be uploaded to public repos.
sentences.chinese: 我无法上传到公开回购一些专有的罐子。

sentences.english: The jar will hold a kilo.
How full is the cookie jar?
sentences.chinese: 曲奇饼干的罐子有多满？

sentences.english: Excavations of the mound revealed deposits containing a surprisingly large number of broken pots.
sentences.chinese: 对这个山包挖掘后发现了大量破碎罐子。

sentences.english: You train fleas by potting them in a jar with a top on it.
sentences.chinese: 你将跳蚤放进一个带盖的罐子里。

sentences.english: Tip jar with lid on to shift product into sifter.
sentences.chinese: 提示罐子的盖子上改变产品的筛子。

sentences.english: An elegant glass jar full of salty and delicious California Pistachios , want it?
sentences.chinese: 雅致的罐子，装满了咸香的加州开心果。想要吗？

sentences.english: The jar must be well sealed.
Dare you swear that you really were in the jar?
sentences.chinese: 你敢肯定你真地曾经躺在那个罐子里吗？

definition: jug (earthenware with a big belly and a small opening)
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
container for holding and pouring water (or other liquid): jug, pitcher, clay jar, jerry can, water bottle etc
